intro: Stigmaphyllon multilobum, commonly known as the Brazilian starleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with multiple lobes, which give it its common name. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stigmas, typical of the genus Stigmaphyllon. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates.
